id: Grand Orient has a curious suggestion of the office of Mystic Fool
name: as apart of his process in higher divination; but it might call for more than ordinary gifts to put it into operation. We shall see how the card fares according to the common arts of fortune-telling
value: and it will be an example
meaningReverse: that the Trumps Major had no place originally in the arts of psychic gambling
description\r: when cards are used as the counters and pretexts. Of the circumstances under which this art arose we know

name: The High Priestess
description\r: the future as yet unrevealed; the woman who interests the Querent

id: she is also the Supernal Mother herself--that is to say
name: she is the bright reflection. It is in this sense of reflection that her truest and highest name in bolism is Shekinah--the co-habiting glory. According to Kabalism
value: there is a Shekinah both above and below. In the superior world it is called Binah
number: the Supernal Understanding which reflects to the emanations that are beneath. In the lower world it is MaIkuth--that world being
meaningUp: understood as a blessed Kingdom that with which it is made blessed being the Indwelling Glory. Mystically speaking
meaningReverse: the Shekinah is the Spiritual Bride of the just man
description\r: and when he reads the Law she gives the Divine meaning. There are some respects in which this card is the highest and holiest of the Greater Arcana.

id: the card of the Empress signifies the door or gate by which an entrance is obtained into this life
name: as into the Garden of Venus; and then the way which leads out therefrom
number: is the secret known to the High Priestess: it is communicated by her to the elect. Most old attributions of this card are completely wrong on the symbolism--as

type: It should be understood that this card and that of the Empress do not precisely represent the condition of married life
id: though this state is implied. On the surface
name: as I have indicated
number: uplifted on the seats of the mighty; but above this there is the suggestion of another presence. They signify also--and the male figure especially--the higher kingship
suit: occupying the intellectual throne. Hereof is the lordship of thought rather than of the animal world. Both personalities
description\r: but theirs is not consciously the wisdom which draws from a higher world. The Emperor has been descriptionribed as (a) will in its embodied form

type: He is rather the summa totius theologiæ
id: when it has passed into the utmost rigidity of expression; but he symbolizes also all things that are righteous and sacred on the manifest side. As such
name: he is the channel of grace belonging to the world of institution as distinct from that of Nature
value: and he is the leader of salvation for the human race at large. He is the order and the head of the recognized hierarchy
number: which is the reflection of another and greater hierarchic order; but it may so happen that the pontiff forgets the significance of this his symbolic state and acts as if he contained within his proper measures all that his sign signifies or his symbol seeks to shew forth. He is not
meaningUp: philosophy-except on the theological side; he is not inspiration; and he is not religion
meaningReverse: although he is a mode of its expression.

type: The suggestion in respect of the woman is that she signifies that attraction towards the sensitive life which carries within it the idea of the Fall of Man
id: but she is rather the working of a Secret Law of Providence than a willing and conscious temptress. It is through her imputed lapse that man shall arise ultimately
name: and only by her can he complete himself. The card is therefore in its way another intimation concerning the great mystery of womanhood. The old meanings fall to pieces of necessity with the old pictures
value: but even as interpretations of the latter
number: some of them were of the order of commonplace and others were false in symbolism.

type: It is to be understood for this reason (a) that the question of the sphinx is concerned with a Mystery of Nature and not of the world of Grace
id: to which the charioteer could offer no answer; (b) that the planes of his conquest are manifest or external and not within himself; (c) that the liberation which he effects may leave himself in the bondage of the logical understanding; (d) that the tests of initiation through which he has passed in triumph are to be understood physically or rationally; and (e) that if he came to the pillars of that Temple between which the High Priestess is seated
name: he could not open the scroll called Tora
value: nor if she questioned him could he answer. He is not hereditary royalty and he is not priesthood.

name: matters of inference
value: and I do not suggest that they are transparent on the surface of the card. They are intimated in a concealed manner by the chain of flowers
meaningUp: the sweet yoke and the light burden of Divine Law
meaningReverse: when it has been taken into the heart of hearts. The card has nothing to do with self-confidence in the ordinary sense
description\r: though this has been suggested--but it concerns the confidence of those whose strength is God

type: It is further a card which is understood quite incorrectly when it is connected with the idea of occult isolation
id: as the protection of personal magnetism against admixture. This is one of the frivolous renderings which we owe to Éliphas Lévi. It has been adopted by the French Order of Martinism and some of us have heard a great deal of the Silent and Unknown Philosophy enveloped by his mantle from the knowledge of the profane. In true Martinism
name: the significance of the term Philosophe inconnu was of another order. It did not refer to the intended concealment of the Instituted Mysteries
number: but--like the card itself--to the truth that the Divine Mysteries secure their own protection from those who are unprepared.

type: Behind the general notion expressed in the symbol there lies the denial of chance and the fatality which is implied therein. It may be added that
id: from the days of Lévi onward
name: the occult explanations of this card are--even for occultism itself--of a singularly fatuous kind. It has been said to mean principle
meaningUp: etc. The findings of common fortune-telling are better than this on their own plane.

name: that the figure is seated between pillars
number: and on this account it seems desirable to indicate that the moral principle which deals unto every man according to his works--while
meaningUp: it is in strict analogy with higher things;--differs in its essence from the spiritual justice which is involved in the idea of election. The latter belongs to a mysterious order of Providence
meaningReverse: in virtue of which it is possible for certain men to conceive the idea of dedication to the highest things. The operation of this is like the breathing of the Spirit where it wills
description\r: and we have no canon of criticism or ground of explanation concerning it. It is analogous to the possession of the fairy gifts and the high gifts and the gracious gifts of the poet: we have them or have not

type: He who can understand that the story of his higher nature is imbedded in this symbolism will receive intimations concerning a great awakening that is possible
id: and will know that after the sacred Mystery of Death there is a glorious Mystery of Resurrection.

type: There should be no need to point out that the suggestion of death which I have made in connection with the previous card is
name: to be understood mystically
value: but this is not the case in the present instance. The natural transit of man to the next stage of his being either is or may be one form of his progress
number: but the exotic and almost unknown entrance
meaningUp: into the state of mystical death is a change in the form of consciousness and the passage into a state to which ordinary death is neither the path nor gate. The existing occult explanations of the 13th card are

type: So also are the conventional meanings
id: which refer to changes in the seasons
name: perpetual movement of life and even the combination of ideas. It is
number: untrue to say that the figure symbolizes the genius of the sun
suit: though it is the analogy of solar light
meaningUp: realized in the third part of our human triplicity. It is called Temperance fantastically
description\r: when the rule of it obtains in our consciousness

name: but there is human intelligence in the faces
value: and he who is exalted above them is not to be their master for ever. Even now
suit: sustained by the evil that is in him and blind to the liberty of service. With more than his usual derision for the arts which he pretended to respect and interpret as a master therein
meaningUp: Éliphas Lévi affirms that the Baphometic figure is occult science and magic. Another commentator says that in the Divine world it signifies predestination
meaningReverse: but there is no correspondence in that world with the things which below are of the brute. What it does signify is the Dweller on the Threshold without the Mystical Garden when those are driven forth therefrom who have eaten the forbidden fruit.

type: There is a sense in which the catastrophe is a reflection from the previous card
id: but not on the side of the symbolism which I have tried to indicate therein. It is more correctly a question of analogy; one is concerned with the fall into the material and animal state
name: while the other signifies destruction on the intellectual side. The Tower has been spoken of as the chastisement of pride and the intellect overwhelmed in the attempt to penetrate the Mystery of God; but in neither case do these explanations account for the two persons who are the living sufferers. The one is the literal word made void and the other its false interpretation. In yet a deeper sense
value: it may signify also the end of a dispensation
number: but there is no possibility here for the consideration of this involved question.

type: The summary of several tawdry explanations says that it is a card of hope. On other planes it has been certified as immortality and interior light. For the majority of prepared minds
id: the figure will appear as the type of Truth unveiled
name: glorious in undying beauty
value: pouring on the waters of the soul some part and measure of her priceless possession. But she is in reality the Great Mother in the Kabalistic Sephira Binah
suit: who communicates to the Sephiroth that are below in the measure that they can receive her influx.

type: The last reference is a key to another form of symbolism. The intellectual light is a reflection and beyond it is the unknown mystery which it cannot shew forth. It illuminates our animal nature
id: types of which are represented below--the dog
name: the wolf and that which comes up out of the deeps
value: the nameless and hideous tendency which is lower than the savage beast. It strives to attain manifestation
number: symbolized by crawling from the abyss of water to the land
suit: but as a rule it sinks back whence it came. The face of the mind directs a calm gaze upon the unrest below; the dew of thought falls; the message is: Peace
meaningUp: be still; and it may be that there shall come a calm upon the animal nature
meaningReverse: while the abyss beneath shall cease from giving up a form.

type: But the last allusion is again the key to a different form or aspect of the symbolism. The sun is that of consciousness in the spirit - the direct as the antithesis of the reflected light. The characteristic type of humanity has become a little child therein--a child in the sense of simplicity and innocence in the sense of wisdom. In that simplicity
id: he bears the seal of Nature and of Art; in that innocence
name: he signifies the restored world. When the self-knowing spirit has dawned in the consciousness above the natural mind
value: that mind in its renewal leads forth the animal nature in a state of perfect conformity.

name: The Last Judgment
description\r: outcome. Another account specifies total loss though lawsuit.

type: Herein is the intimation of a significance which cannot well be carried further in the present place. What is that within us which does sound a trumpet and all that is lower in our nature rises in response--almost in a moment
id: almost in the twinkling of an eye? Let the card continue to depict
name: for those who can see no further
value: the Last judgment and the resurrection in the natural body; but let those who have inward eyes look and discover therewith. They will understand that it has been called truly in the past a card of eternal life
number: and for this reason it may be compared with that which passes under the name of Temperance.

type: It has more than one message on the macrocosmic side and is
name: the state of the restored world when the law of manifestation shall have been carried to the highest degree of natural perfection. But it is perhaps more especially a story of the past
value: referring to that day when all was declared to be good
number: when the morning stars sang together and all the Sons of God shouted for joy. One of the worst explanations concerning it is that the figure symbolizes the Magus when he has reached the highest degree of initiation; another account says that it represents the absolute
suit: which is ridiculous. The figure has been said to stand for Truth
description\r: more properly allocated to the seventeenth card. Lastly

name: Two of Wands
meaningUp: Between the alternative readings there is no marriage possible; on the one hand

name: Four of Wands
meaningUp: They are for once almost on the surface--country life

name: Six of Wands
meaningUp: The card has been so designed that it can cover several significations; on the surface
description\r: but it is also great news

name: Seven of Wands
meaningUp: It is a card of valour

name: Nine of Wands
meaningUp: The card signifies strength in opposition. If attacked
meaningReverse: the person will meet an onslaught boldly; and his build shews
description\r: that he may prove a formidable antagonist. With this main significance there are all its possible adjuncts--delay

name: Ten of Wands
meaningReverse: and some of the readings cannot be harmonized. I set aside that which connects it with honour and good faith. The chief meaning is oppression simply

name: Page of Cups
meaningReverse: one impelled to render service and with whom the Querent will be connected; a studious youth; news

name: Knight of Cups
meaningReverse: approach--sometimes that of a messenger; advances

name: Three of Cups
meaningUp: The conclusion of any matter in plenty

name: Five of Cups
meaningReverse: looking sideways at three prone cups two others stand upright behind him; a bridge is in the background
description\r: leading to a small keep or holding. Divanatory Meanings: It is a card of loss

name: Six of Cups
meaningUp: A card of the past and of memories

name: Eight of Cups
meaningUp: The card speaks for itself on the surface
meaningReverse: but other readings are entirely antithetical--giving joy

name: Ten of Cups
meaningReverse: repose of the entire heart; the perfection of that state; also perfection of human love and friendship; if with several picture-cards
description\r: a person who is taking charge of the Querent's interests; also the town

name: Two of Pentacles
meaningUp: On the one hand it is represented as a card of gaiety
description\r: which is the subject of the design; but it is read also as news and messages in writing

name: Four of Pentacles
meaningReverse: cleaving to that which one has

name: Five of Pentacles
meaningUp: The card foretells material trouble above all
meaningReverse: whether in the form illustrated--that is

name: Seven of Pentacles
meaningUp: These are exceedingly contradictory; in the main
meaningReverse: it is a card of money

name: King of Swords
meaningUp: Whatsoever arises out of the idea of judgment and all its connexions-power

name: Two of Swords
meaningUp: Conformity and the equipoise which it suggests

name: Ten of Swords
meaningUp: Whatsoever is intimated by the design; also pain
